candidate.notes: Matched 6 tech signals. Size: small, Region: India

pivot.label: Enterprise AI expansion — Series A + AWS partnership + enterprise sales hiring

evidence.text: Hiring Senior ML Engineer — build real-time inference pipelines for enterprise clients. Experience with K8s, Ray Serve, and model monitoring required.
Head of Enterprise Sales — drive 6-figure ACV deals with Fortune 500 clients. Track record in AI/ML SaaS required.

tech_debt.label: Monolith to composable inference mesh migration underway

evidence.text: Platform Engineer (DevOps) — migrate monolithic training infra to cloud-native microservices on AWS EKS. Terraform + Helm experience mandatory.
GitHub org shows 8 active repos: ML inference framework, K8s operators, data pipeline tools. 340+ stars on main repo. CI/CD with GitHub Actions.

raw_texts.text: Hiring Senior ML Engineer — build real-time inference pipelines for enterprise clients. Experience with K8s, Ray Serve, and model monitoring required.
Platform Engineer (DevOps) — migrate monolithic training infra to cloud-native microservices on AWS EKS. Terraform + Helm experience mandatory.
Data Engineer — design and maintain ETL pipelines processing 50M+ events/day. Apache Beam, BigQuery, and Airflow.
Head of Enterprise Sales — drive 6-figure ACV deals with Fortune 500 clients. Track record in AI/ML SaaS required.
Krea.ai raises $12M Series A to expand enterprise AI platform into US market. CEO says 'We're targeting $5M ARR by Q4 2026.'
Krea.ai partners with AWS to offer GPU-optimized inference endpoints. Enterprise customers get dedicated model hosting.
GitHub org shows 8 active repos: ML inference framework, K8s operators, data pipeline tools. 340+ stars on main repo. CI/CD with GitHub Actions.
CTO blog post: 'Why we moved from monolithic model serving to a composable inference mesh — 4x throughput, 60% cost reduction on AWS.'

opportunity.strategic_summary: Krea.ai is expanding from product-led AI into enterprise accounts with a fresh $12M Series A. Their infrastructure migration from monolithic to composable inference and active K8s + data pipeline hiring signals strong alignment with DataVex cloud DevOps and data engineering capabilities.
why_we_win: Direct capability match: Krea needs K8s migration + data pipeline expertise — DataVex core strength
Timing: Series A capital + enterprise sales hire = budget allocated for infrastructure partners
CTO blog confirms composable architecture goals — DataVex has delivered similar transformations
Small team (150) means vendor decisions happen fast with fewer stakeholders
risks: Small company may prefer hiring in-house over consulting engagement
AI-native team may have strong opinions about architecture — need to demo engineering depth
Deal size may start below $500K minimum until enterprise revenue materializes

decision_maker.name: Ankit Mehta
decision_maker.messaging_angle: Your inference mesh migration needs infrastructure partners who've scaled K8s + data pipelines for enterprise AI — DataVex has done this for 3 similar-stage companies.
persona_risks: CTO founded the company — strong ownership of architecture decisions
May prefer open-source tooling over vendor solutions

decision_maker.role_selection_rationale: Selected CTO because company state is TECH_MODERNIZATION. Primary focus: innovation. Communication style: visionary.

outreach.email:
Subject: Re: Your inference mesh migration

Ankit —

Your CTO blog on moving from monolithic model serving to composable inference was sharp — 4x throughput and 60% cost reduction is exactly the kind of lift we build infrastructure for.

With 150 engineers scaling to enterprise and fresh Series A capital, the K8s migration and data pipeline build-out will define your next 12 months.

We've run this exact migration for 3 AI-native companies at your stage — shared artifact registries, sub-5-minute CI, production inference pipelines processing 50M+ events/day.

Worth 20 minutes to compare architectures?

— DataVex
outreach.linkedin_dm: Ankit — loved the composable inference mesh post. With Krea scaling to enterprise, the K8s + data pipeline build matters. We've done this exact migration for 3 similar-stage AI companies. Worth comparing notes?
outreach.call_opener: Ankit, quick question — with the enterprise push and 50M events/day pipeline target, how are you sequencing the K8s migration against the data infrastructure build-out?
personalization_notes: Hook derived from careers signal: 'Hiring Senior ML Engineer — build real-time inference pipelines for enterprise c...'
Tech debt evidence from careers: 'Platform Engineer (DevOps) — migrate monolithic training infra to cloud-native m...'
why_this_message: Pivot signal (Enterprise AI expansion — Series A + AWS partnership + enterprise sales hiring) drives problem framing
Tech debt (Monolith to composable inference mesh migration underway) validates DataVex cloud_devops capability
risk_adjustments: Risk: CTO founded the company — strong ownership of architecture decisions → Adjusted tone to be more consultative
Risk: May prefer open-source tooling over vendor solutions → Adjusted tone to be more consultative

candidate.notes: Matched 6 tech signals. Size: mid, Region: India

tech_debt.label: Legacy Java monolith blocking velocity — 28min CI builds, strangler fig migration stalled

evidence.text: Staff Engineer — decompose monolithic payment processing engine into event-driven microservices. Java/Kotlin + Kafka experience.
Data Warehouse Architect — migrate from on-prem MySQL cluster to Snowflake. Must optimize for regulatory reporting.
GitHub shows legacy Java repos with 200+ open issues. Recent PRs reference 'strangler fig migration' pattern. CI builds averaging 28 minutes.

fiscal_pressure.label: 10% layoff, 30% burn reduction mandate, profitability pressure

evidence.text: Slice lays off 10% of workforce amid funding winter. CEO memo: 'Focus on profitability path, reduce burn by 30%.'
VP Engineering post: 'Our technical debt is our biggest blocker to profitability — every feature takes 3x longer than it should.'

raw_texts.text: Staff Engineer — decompose monolithic payment processing engine into event-driven microservices. Java/Kotlin + Kafka experience.
Data Warehouse Architect — migrate from on-prem MySQL cluster to Snowflake. Must optimize for regulatory reporting.
SRE Lead — reduce P0 incident rate by 50%. Currently averaging 4 production incidents per week.
Slice lays off 10% of workforce amid funding winter. CEO memo: 'Focus on profitability path, reduce burn by 30%.'
Slice migrating core banking stack from legacy Java monolith to cloud-native architecture. Estimated 18-month timeline.
GitHub shows legacy Java repos with 200+ open issues. Recent PRs reference 'strangler fig migration' pattern. CI builds averaging 28 minutes.
VP Engineering post: 'Our technical debt is our biggest blocker to profitability — every feature takes 3x longer than it should.'

opportunity.strategic_summary: Slice is under dual pressure: cost-cutting mandate from 10% layoffs and a stalled legacy Java monolith migration that's blocking engineering velocity. Their SRE hiring and 4 P0 incidents/week create urgency for DataVex's cloud modernization and data engineering capabilities.
why_we_win: Legacy modernization is DataVex's sweet spot — strangler fig pattern, cloud migration tooling
Cost pressure means they need a partner who delivers ROI, not a moonshot vendor
VP Eng blog post explicitly calls tech debt 'the biggest blocker to profitability' — they know the problem
risks: Budget may be constrained given layoffs and burn reduction goals
Internal politics: layoffs create fear, new vendor engagement may face resistance

decision_maker.name: Rajesh Krishnamurthy
decision_maker.messaging_angle: Your tech debt is costing you 3x on every feature — DataVex can cut your monolith migration timeline by 60% and get CI builds under 8 minutes.
pain_points_aligned: P0 incident rate eroding customer trust
Cost pressure requiring ROI-positive vendor choices
persona_risks: Budget-constrained after layoffs — any engagement needs clear ROI framing
May be defensive about existing architecture decisions

decision_maker.role_selection_rationale: Selected CTO because company state is TECH_MODERNIZATION. Primary focus: cost. Communication style: ROI-driven.

outreach.email:
Subject: Monolith migration — closing the 3x velocity gap

Rajesh —

28-minute CI builds and 4 P0 incidents per week on a monolith that your VP Eng calls 'the biggest blocker to profitability.' That math doesn't improve on its own.

We've run strangler-fig decompositions at 4 fintech companies at your scale — average outcome: CI under 8 minutes, P0s down 70%, feature velocity 3x in 90 days.

With the 30% burn reduction mandate, you need a partner that delivers measurable ROI, not a 18-month consulting engagement. We scope to 90-day milestones.

20 minutes to walk through the decomposition playbook?

— DataVex
outreach.linkedin_dm: Rajesh — 28-minute CI builds and 4 P0 incidents/week on a monolith is rough. We helped 4 similar fintechs hit sub-8-minute builds and 70% fewer incidents in 90 days. Worth a quick look?
outreach.call_opener: Rajesh, with the 30% burn reduction mandate and the monolith migration on an 18-month timeline — how are you prioritizing which services to decompose first?
personalization_notes: Tech debt evidence from careers: 'Staff Engineer — decompose monolithic payment processing engine into event-drive...'
Fiscal signal from news: 'Slice lays off 10% of workforce amid funding winter. CEO memo: 'Focus on profita...'
why_this_message: Tech debt (Legacy Java monolith blocking velocity — 28min CI builds, strangler fig migration stalled) validates DataVex cloud_devops capability
Fiscal pressure (10% layoff, 30% burn reduction mandate, profitability pressure) creates urgency for ROI messaging
risk_adjustments: Risk: Budget-constrained after layoffs — any engagement needs clear ROI framing → Softened CTA, emphasized ROI framing
Risk: May be defensive about existing architecture decisions → Adjusted tone to be more consultative

candidate.notes: Matched 5 tech signals. Size: small, Region: India

pivot.label: Government AI contract — sovereign AI stack for healthcare and agriculture

evidence.text: Sarvam AI wins ₹200Cr government contract to build India's sovereign AI stack. Focus on healthcare and agriculture NLP.

raw_texts.text: Research Scientist — develop multilingual LLMs for Indian languages. PhD preferred. Publishing record at top ML venues.
Infra Engineer — build GPU cluster management platform for 1000+ A100 nodes. SLURM + K8s hybrid scheduling.
Sarvam AI wins ₹200Cr government contract to build India's sovereign AI stack. Focus on healthcare and agriculture NLP.
Sarvam AI announces Sarvam-1, a 7B parameter multilingual model trained on 22 Indian languages.
Private repos — limited visibility. Public model cards on HuggingFace show active ML research. No public infra repos.
CEO interview: 'We're building India's AI infrastructure layer — government-first, enterprise later. Revenue is secondary to impact right now.'

opportunity.strategic_summary: Sarvam AI has strong government backing but limited commercial urgency. Their focus is research-first with revenue as secondary. DataVex capability alignment is narrow — primarily AI analytics, not their core infrastructure need of GPU cluster management.
why_we_win: Government contracts require compliance and data engineering capabilities DataVex offers
risks: Revenue is secondary to impact — unlikely to prioritize vendor partnerships
80-person team with PhD-heavy culture may not value consulting partnerships
Government procurement cycles are slow and unpredictable

decision_maker.name: Vivek Raghavan
decision_maker.messaging_angle: Your government AI contracts need production-grade data pipelines and compliance infrastructure — DataVex builds the layer between research and deployment.
persona_risks: Research-first culture may deprioritize infrastructure tooling
Government procurement requires lengthy approval cycles

decision_maker.role_selection_rationale: Selected Head of Data / VP Engineering because company state is GROWTH. Primary focus: innovation. Communication style: visionary.

outreach.email:
Subject: Data infrastructure for sovereign AI

Vivek —

Congratulations on the ₹200Cr government AI contract. Building India's sovereign AI stack for healthcare and agriculture is ambitious — and the data engineering layer between Sarvam-1 and production deployment will make or break the timeline.

We build production-grade data pipelines and compliance infrastructure for AI teams — the layer that turns research models into reliable government-grade deployments.

Happy to share how we've built similar infrastructure — no commitment, just relevant architecture patterns.

— DataVex
outreach.linkedin_dm: Vivek — congrats on the ₹200Cr government AI contract. The data pipeline layer between Sarvam-1 and production deployment is where we live. Happy to share relevant architecture patterns.
outreach.call_opener: Vivek, with the government AI contract and Sarvam-1 model — what does the production deployment pipeline look like for healthcare and agriculture use cases?

why_this_message: Pivot signal (Government AI contract — sovereign AI stack for healthcare and agriculture) drives problem framing
risk_adjustments: Risk: Research-first culture may deprioritize infrastructure tooling → Adjusted tone to be more consultative
Risk: Government procurement requires lengthy approval cycles → Adjusted tone to be more consultative
